title: Great app, great info, very reliable
text: I have used Polar Flow with my Vantage M for the last two and a half years.  I really enjoy seeing the heart rate graphs for each workout and how they compare to previous workouts.  Polar Flow also shows you a graph of how much “strain” you can take based off your last seven days and your average strain over the last month.  With Polar Flow I can easily see if I have been consistent or falling off in intensity and duration.  It’s detailed enough that I can nerd out, or just feel guilty for too many “recovery” days.  I do a wide variety of workouts as well but the Polar program really shines when it comes to running.  Great in app maps, pace counts, and detailed analysis on the supporting website.  Very accurate prediction for future running performance. The Vantage M paired with Polar Flow has been a worthy investment that I have enjoyed for several years.

title: Death by comparison
text:
I enjoy flexibility. I enjoy compatibility. 
My vantage m and the polar app have some great features. I like seeing my progress and the ability to gauge overreaching mixed with poor sleep. I enjoy the sport profiles and being able to set heart rate monitored activities and non heart rate activities. But over the last two years I have a small wish list. 1) I have to restart the polar app every time i want to sync with my watch. 2)There is no find your phone option.  3) Cant charge the watch in the middle of an activity. This is nice for long days bike-packing. Garmin allows overnight charging without stopping the activity. This way the entire route is one post.  4) I am in the medical field and frequently need to count respirations or heart rate using a second hand. The second hand on my polar only displays for about six seconds when i raise my wrist so its not helpful. 5) Zwift: Polar does not link with zwift so I cant see my heart rate data from my watch on the zwift platform. This is a dilemma when I want to track strain and progress with polar. I have to start my watch as well as wear a heart rate strap compatible with zwift. I then have to delete the strava activity (i use both fitness platforms to track progress) Compatibility with other apps and platforms would be great!
I have really enjoyed the watch however couple things that I would like to improve. Thanks Polar!

title: Slow Heart Rate display and inaccurate sleep tracking.
text:
I like most things about the App and my Polar Vantage M. However there are two areas needing significant improvement. These are:
- The delay in displaying heart rate. Because of this delay it is easy to overshoot my maximum heart rate while exercising. I have verified this delay by comparing the M’s reading to that of various pieces of exercise equipment. However, when hiking, or doing other activities, without another piece of equipment to track the actual heart rate it is easy to overrun, or underachieve. 
- Like many people over the age of 60, I have to get up during the night to relieve myself. Unfortunately the Polar Vantage M and or the Polar app think that I rwmain awake from that point forward, even though I do go back to sleep. Again, I see a very substantial difference between what Polar believes is my sleep time and that shown by my CPAP machine...
PS: Every NickName I tried to use to submit this review was reported as taken, including “AllNickNamesTaken”, so I am about to resort to a random collection of characters to see if that will work.........!!!!!!!!

title: Polar Is the Best - 30+ Years w/ Polar
text:
I had a pair of Polar AXN700 for over a decade and had one I finally had to strap together with duct tape. I finally purchased a Vantage V and absolutely love it. Everything about the hardware and software is outstanding. 

I considered an Apple but Polar holds a charge so much longer it just works better for my needs. The Pilar Flow program is great. If I had a “magic wand” I would like to see a couple fields added where I can add information - such as the name of my trail route, etc. But this is a small detail. The other thing I’d really like is an automatic link to my Dark Sky weather app so it would be visible on my watch as well as embedded in my data. 

So I love my Polar and recommend it highly.

title: Syncing is a mission
text: Im a fairly new user - only got my device a month. Although I like the look and feel, syncing is not a simple task. I’ll sink and expect it to be working only to find that it hasn’t or hasn’t uploaded a full days results. I’ve resorted to taking the device off and placing it on my cellular screen to sync as alternatively suggested and although that appears to work better, at times it throws the time off. Last Friday was such an example and got me into some trouble for thinking I had to leave a meeting already only to find out I had the wrong time. Embarrassing and frustrating! I had a much cheaper device and experienced none of these challenges in the past. If this experience continues, I’ll have no choice but to revert back to the old device. Pity is I bought an extra four devices to give as Christmas gifts and at the moment, I’m regretting have done so as I expect they’re going to be frustrated too.

title: Questionable Data, Uncalibrateable
text:
I bought the 430 for the wrist based heartrate monitoring and im extremely satisfied with that. 

With that said when i run on the treadmill the data collected is extremely questionable. It has never given me an accurate distance. Today’s run it captured 3.5miles of 5. Unfortunately the flow app doesn’t allow me to calibrate for my stride/Light footstrike and correct the inaccurate distance. This means you’re left with a completely worthless run data history. Worse is the questions it raises about the other data captured. If it missed 1.5miles making it completely off on your pace, how accurate is the cadence data. Also best of luck if you forget to stop your workout because there is no way to correct the inaccurate data. I find myself depending on a lot of other apps just like when i had my polar FT1. The polar flow app needs a lot of enhancements and leaves much to be desired from this runner.

title: Best Exercise and Training Partner!!
text: I can’t rave enough about my Polar Grit Training Watch.  It is amazingly rugged & durable.  It has all the functions I need except for logging interval runs, but that is a minor  take-away from an outstanding watch.  The only problem I have with it is that I run with a focus on my heart rate and zones.  I am also slightly color blind so when it move from the 4th into the 5th zone I have trouble reading the heart rate number.  Wish there was a way to change the color scheme to suit my vision issues...Don’t get me wrong, if mine should ever fail/break, which seems highly unlikely considering the beating I have already given it, I will definitely get another one!!

title: Very solid app
text: Firstly, i have the Polar m400 which is an awesome watch. I'm impressed with this app too. I prefer this to the desktop, which isn't as flawless when syncing (download a new version and lose my data? Nope) and so far this works fine mechanically. Feed Interface is a little cluttered and seems harder than it should be to navigate back through the calendar and see timings. Pretty good graphs, trying to see if there's a way to compare timings but that is my only nitpick. Might have to import into Excel. As mentioned, the watch itself, an m400, is Rock solid after busting a few Garmins that are irreparable. Very simple easy to use menu. It just works.

title: Couple of issues, otherwise great
text:
1. When I wear the V800 watch to sleep, it doesn’t always track my sleep correctly. For example, I fell asleep on the couch pretty early then woke up and got in bed late. It only counted the time after I went to bed as sleep. 
2. Elevation isn’t shown on the workout in the app, I have to go to the full website to see it.
3. The HR monitor strap isn’t the best - it misses measurements; I actually need to test it with the phone as well as the watch to try and isolate the issue. 

I’ve mostly worn the watch as a daily tracker and used it with HR monitor for running, bike rides, hiking, etc. and overall, it’s pretty good, no major issues. My first V800 melted when I tried to recharge it and they replaced it. The second one seems to be holding up really well.

title: Sleep tracker inadequate
text: Since this last update (which by the way doesn’t mention having fixed anything on sleep tracker) sleep track is down to random performance. Contacting support is an exercise in frustration in that that regurgitate to me the same things on the support page that got me to them and then tell me how I need to sleep in order for their application to work. People serving software? I thought it was supposed to be the other way around. I like the other features (other than synch, which is ridiculously slow) but my frustration with sleep tracker leaves me open to other, better solutions (i.e. non-polar).

title: More loyal to polar with each device they release
text: I see nothing that would make me want to change to some other brand of devices. They clearly follow their own vision and reach to accomplish achievements that are beyond simply filling a marketing opportunity. Polar continues to set a standard that many people are not even able to recognize... my advice is. Take a good look and really think about what they are doing. A simple example: think for a second why Polar is the only device with a 40 hour workout time at the quality level they provide. They are ahead of the trend because they are the source of it

title: Excellent Exercise Log
text: I’ve been using Polar Heart Rate Monitors for over 10 years as I had rate induced A-fib and really needed to keep a check on my heart rate.  I have used Polar Flo and their software before to download my activity and analyze various things.  Can’t tell you how easy this app is to use and seamless it is to download from my monitor.  With GPS I am able to tack all of my routes, compare rides from previous ones, etc.   Use mainly for cycling but when I ran, also used to track my running, cadence, etc. Great product and great software.

title: Needs better support for interval training
text:
I like the vantage V for HR and power but very disappointed that it does support interval training very well.
The Phased Target is a good construct but usually each phase is a lap but Flow doesn’t seem to tag them that way. When I import data into Strava or even the flow app, still don’t know straight away my average speed in each of the phases (FYI the automatic lap is turned off )

The corresponding issue on the watch is that there is no way to know what avg speed I’m going at in each phase cos the phases aren’t treated as laps. 

For example I need to be able to create the phased target (see below), start the run, should never need to touch the watch until the work out ends and be able to see avg pace + avg HR in each phase and this contextual information needs to be tagged and saved so I can import and see it.

Example : 
10m warmup
4 X 1k @ 3:40 with 60 sec rest
5 min easy jog
4 x 1k @ 3:40 with 60 sec rest
10 min cool down

I recently switched from Garmin and super disappointed I can’t do this over in polar. I hope this gets addressed soon.

Thanks
Ravi

title: Almost Perfect
text: This app is very good. For my polar vantage v, it provides easy syncing and update transfer, while for workout analysis it provides a wide range of helpful analyses. I only wish this app had two additional features that seem to be awkwardly missing considering everything related to them has been included. First, for running workout analysis I wish the app would have similar splits functionality to what they provide on the flow website, allowing users to auto split workouts into .5, 1, and 2 mile splits. Second, I wish that, for the apple health syncing, flow provided distance data like it provides workout and other health data.

text:
So far, I believe I am tracking everything…

title: Accuracy
text: Polar flow is the premier fitness device.  It’s been around since the 1980’s.  I’ve tried other devices, but none of them compare in accuracy, some devices I’ve researched don’t even show margin of error.  Polar has been, and still is, used in research and in hospitals.  I’m sticking with Polar because of accuracy and the best function.  Makes sense, because they’ve been around long before fitness devices were trendy and after decades of experience with this technology they still have the BEST products for these markets ❤️

title: Forced to upgrade
text:
The customer who paid for their device should determine if/when to upgrade. I was greeted with a "...your version is outdated...please upgrade..." message. In fact there is no please about it. The app suddenly will not work with Polar Balance (scale) since the update message is sitting on top of the scale button. Why don't I want to upgrade? Because everytime I've upgraded in the past Polar has lost or deleted several months of weight data. Unlike the Polar Beat app which has never lost any old data the Polar Flow app seems to periodically lose old data.
May 12,2021 update:  Now this poor excuse for a program has decided to switch my weight to kg - it ignores my setting it to imperial (pounds) and reverts to metric (kilograms) after I set it to imperial!

title: Great with Polar Unite
text: My goal is optimum fitness & health. My Polar Unite and this app tell me what works and what doesn’t. I’ve learned that alcohol — even 2 drinks — always has a negative effect on my sleep metrics, specifically relating to my heart. Eye-opening. On the other hand, whenever I do even the mildest exercise — a daily brisk walk and/or yoga, my sleep improves and my resting heart rate goes down. Sure, these findings may be “from the journal of ‘duh’,” but there’s something about seeing the impact firsthand that motivates me to make better health choices. Recommended.

title: Gets the job done
text: Polar flow gets the job done. It provides a good break down of what I did. Though I never seem to have the same distance and elevation between my device and how Strava analyzes the information I don’t know if it’s accuracy is off, but when using downloaded maps it shows turns within feet of where they are. The particular product I use V650 seems to be lacking in some modern features. I do not know if this is limited to this product or others. But for the price compared to a Garmin, it is completely worth. Any additional features would cost hundreds more with a Garmin.

title: Great system and professionally focused.
text: Great features, accuracy, many ways for workout and training analysis. At times,  devices don’t sync when opening the app and you have to close the app and restart  Flow to sync with Grit X or Ignite watches. The Beat app is good too and I wish I could sync my prepared training into Polar Beat app. Prepared training only shows on Flow app and it could allow such feature to be used on Polar Beat app too. Overall great features, great company, and keep adding more and making improving.

title: You track your business but not your body?
text: I’m a business guy and I love the tracking that we do to ensure that our business is running as smoothly as it should be. I had never really compared my body to my business, but in reality my body needs to be tracked just like my business does. The profit is in the numbers. And in this case weight loss is by way of tracking your food and your numbers. If you couple this app with my fitness pal for food tracking, it’s nearly impossible not to go in the direction that you want to.

title: Great app - fast and reliable!
text: Love the Polar Flow app! It syncs quickly with my Polar Vantage M2 and the UI is pretty fast. I’ve never had any issues updating my sleep data or workouts. What I appreciate is the highly-detailed info of my sleep, letting me know my REM cycles, interruptions, deep sleep, etc... It also gauges my workouts to let me know how I’m doing during the week. It’ll alert me if I’m maintaining or overreaching in my training. Data is abundant, layout is clear and user-friendly, and the app is reliable. I’m pretty pleased!

title: Updates: AFTER 4.9 NOT APPLICABLE FOR IOS
text:
I have an iPhone 6, which cannot use iOS version 13 and above. The polar flow app versions beyond, I think it’s 4.9, require iOS version 13. Yet, I still get banner alerts within the Polar Flow app saying “your app is outdated, please upload the newest version.“

 Polar either needs to make the newer apps work with pre-iOS 13 versions, or stop the banner alerts to update to a version that you cannot download!

 Aside from this, the app is great, in particular the sleep plus.

title: Best fitness app and support system
text:
Been a Polar Grit X user for nearly a year. This app is great for all workouts and setting up a training calendar with training targets. All customizable.
Apple Watch series 3. Had that watch for three years and I don’t miss it. Don’t miss the Apple workouts or any of that.
Apple Watch wasn’t rugged enough. Polar Grit X, Polar Flow and the polar tools both online and on my Mac computer are great. Everything syncs and stays updated.
Look forward to a long relationship with Polar and polar fitness for life.

title: Still not syncing to mobile devices

It still will since with my PC and I’m living with tha.  I have rest the A370 2 times (or has it been 3) and downloaded the new apps but still can only sync to the PC.  And I can’t find the alarm setting on the PC.  Maybe my next is a Apple Waztch if I can’t get this to work.

title: Keeps crashing my phone
text:
So this is probably my first negative review ever. It has to do with my experience dealing with this app. I’ve been using it for over a year and it has been absolutely solid. Recently there was an update and the app won’t stay open longer than 8 seconds. At first I thought it was my phone but everything works perfectly. Customer service is useless, doesn’t listen and suggest things I already reiterated to them that I tried. I’m just frustrated. It WAS the most used app on my Phone second to iMessage. Now it’s useless. Thanks Polar

title: A370 crashes
text: I’ve always loved Polar and the A370 is no exception. The only problem I’m having with it is it will lose connection and shut down after about an hour and a half of exercise. Sometimes I️ do two workouts back to back (such as weights then Zumba) and it will lose my data and reboot. I’ve tried stopping and starting the second exercise but it still shuts down and I️ lose my second workout.  I️ really love the ease, reliability and heart monitoring along with the enhanced sleep tracking. Just wish it wouldn’t reboot in the middle of my workout.

title: Limited info
text: I wish that this app had as much information available as the Garmin smart watches/HRM’s. So much more data and options to be able to view and track, I am a long time Polar HRM user and have been happy with the accuracy and precision, I had a Garmin Vicioactive 3 for about a week before it got returned and bought a Polar Ignite. The Garmin app was better in my opinion but I like the Polar watch best especially since Garmin uses RMR/Harris-Benedict to estimate caloric burn and not base it off HR. Polar is by far the standard, just wish the app had more options for data collection and storage for training.

title: Polar m430
text: Awesome watch if you want to take your workouts more serious and start tracking accurately. Works great for swimming, running, weight lifting. I’ve had mine for about 9 months and I love it, better than an Apple Watch because I don’t have to worry about cracking the screen if it drops. Also battery life for me usually last anywhere from 3-5 days depending how active I am. Also takes about 30 mins to charge for a full battery.

title: Love the watch, but a few glitches
text: I have trouble syncing my watch with the app about a couple times a week.  I’ve looked at the troubleshooting page and tried the few different ways to get it to work, but unfortunately it doesn’t.  It eventually catches up a few days later when it “decides” to sync.  Also noticed a few times the heart rate monitor is turned on and mid activity, it starts to beep non stop and quits working.  I have to stop my activity and re-set the heart rate on my watch, and again a bit annoying.  Over all,  it a bad watch but the glitches need to be fixed.

title: Very disappointed
text: GPS takes for ever to initialize, even in completely unobstructed areas. Generally between 5 to 15 minutes, making this watch totally useless especially during a competitive run.  My kids have $2 toys that work better. Also watch will seldom automatically synch to app. Customer service always tells me to plug the watch to a PC and use their desktop version. Really?! Never admitted there might be a problem or offer a replacement which means it is working as intended, i.e poorly. I know the M200 is an entry level for Polar but limited functions shouldn’t mean limited quality. Why should I trust Polar with their more advance and pricey products? I won’t.

title: Great hub for multiple Polar devices
text: I have the M400 GPS sports watch and the M450 bike computer, along with a couple accessories, and I love the app as a hub to track my activity in a multiple-device Environment. It might not be for you if you are looking to mix and match brands, but if you buy consistently this app will take care of you. I love that you can customize your sport profiles to show you the live stats you want to see using the app. This will keep me in the Polar for the foreseeable future.

title: I think it needs several improvements.
text:
It works well with the clock in terms of synchronizing and pulling data from my clock. I also really like the GPS feature when I cycle.

Having said that, the design feels like a spreadsheet. It give me the information I want without allowing me to expand and understand better. Also, I cannot zoom in my heart rate data to see the values in better detail. The same is true with my sleep data. Finally, I do not have access to my historic heart rate data apart from the work out sessions.

Thank you!

title: Best polar watch ever

title: Refuses to syn

I wanted the most accurate heart rate monitor on the market, not sure this is it. I have had this app (Polar Flow), Polar Beat, Polar M600 watch, and Polar H10 chest strap for five months now. When they syn and record data it is great! However, now they rarely sync at all!!
For two weeks no problems,  now going into 3rd week of NO SYNCING and NO CONNECTION!! Watch does not sync to chest strap, watch does not sync to Polar Flow and chest strap does not sync to Polar Beat! 
My Fitbit  syncs and connects automatically, never a problem. 
These Polar devices I try every day for 30 minutes to attempt connection. Very  very frustrating.
Polar email support is non existent.

title: Getting better and better
text: I was pretty skeptical about keeping track of so much at first. I’ve grown used to what I find helpful and learned to ignore what might be “too much information” for my sometimes obsessive mind frame. I love the programming capabilities, but wish it were easier to form your own (like when I’m not training for the next marathon). I still haven’t quite figured that out yet.

title: New Version is Bad
text: Very convoluted confusing app. Takes a lot of searching to find your workouts. This is not for people who do actual sports activities and want to track them. This is for daily activity monitoring and making you feel good that you moved. The real training sessions are buried in a mess of useless information. If you sit on the couch all day and need an app to tell you that you should move more and if you wear the watch 24/7 then this might be for you. If you do real sport (running, hiking, biking or whatever) and wear the watch only during exercise then this is a useless mess. I wish there were separate apps for sport and for lifestyle.

title: Pretty pleased
text:
I appreciate a lot about this app. It shows me all the metrics for biking and running I want. Although the connectivity is pretty sketchy with my iPhone. Sometimes takes 3-4 tries and even restarts to get everything to connect. I’ve even had to un-install the app on my phone twice to make it work. 
Mi would also like the app to include the same things the website does, especially the recovery calendar, I find that function very handy. 

Otherwise, good app, better than most others out there

title: Love my Polar M430, H10 sensor, and App!!
text: Nothing fancy about the M430, HR sensor, or the app, but I can't live without these simple tools! They are accurate and provide the necessary exercise feedback I need. I exercise 5-6 days per week, and the durability is exceptional. I wear my M430 daily and has replaced my regular watch. I have had it for 2 years. I had other Polar activity trackers, and in my opinion, Polar beats all others just in simplicity and name alone. I trust the brand and reliability Polar is well known for.

title: I’m addicted!
text: The A370 isn’t my first Polar HR monitor, but it’s my favorite, and it’s most likely because of the app that goes with it. I love being able to select precise workouts when I exercise and to track my progress. I know I will be a loyal customer for life. I recently had to undergo surgery to remove a benign tumor and was told I had the vitals of a teenager. I’m 51yo and have exercised consistently for the past 30 years. I love challenging myself. Being fit is a choice!

title: Issues with Balance.
text: I normally love the app, but it’s been giving me issues for a while now. I use a Vantage V and have a Balance scale. The Balance tab of the app resets to January 30th every time I close the app for some reason. When I weigh myself in the morning, it will still show me my current weight and recent trend, but as soon as I close the app, it goes back to January 30th if I open the app again, so I can’t actually check any status or progress later in the day, and things like activity and food goal features are completely lost. Hopefully this can be fixed in a future update and I can give the app five stars again.

title: Does not sync
text:
The Polar Flow App really need a lot of fixing.  I am not able to sync my device (M440) with the phone.  The syncing works from my PC.  When trying to sync either phone the message is “Syncing failed”.  Polar is not giving any further instructions on how to fix this.

I like the Polar hart rate monitors because I think polar is still the leading brand when it comes to analysis of hr data.  However, the same cannot be said about polars software, polar flow.  Polar flow is not able to present the data in a structured way that would be easy to understand.

In sum: I am buying the polar device because I like the Technoloqy.  I wish they could make better software to support the devices.

title: Easy to use and accurate
text:
I had reservations about buying this or any other device with pulse rate technology. My wife had nothing but disappointing results with at least three other different brand devices. 

The Polar, unlike the previous three devices that failed to measure on results, was user friendly and accurate. Scrolling through the menu on the watch is self explanatory and before long you become an expert with all the interesting function that the Polar has to offer. 

My only criticism is having to re-sync the Polar to the Polar weight scale device, sold separately, on morning weigh-in. I’m still tweaking with it, not really concern about it for now. 

Overall, I’m pleased I purchased the Polar and would recommend it to my friends.

title: I Love The Watch, The APP is so/so
text: After wearing Polar watches about 7 years, I can say the Watches function very well. I’ve have had a lot of connectivity issues with the app. Sometimes my watches won’t connect, the ability for the app to connect and information to flow between non Polar products is cumbersome at best, and non existent for some products. I have not been able to find guidance in user manuals or online help. We’ll continue to see how things go, but other brands are growing expediently in these areas.

title: Limited.

My current app is outdated but my phone doesn’t have iOS 13 so it keeps asking me to update to something I can’t get. It also doesn’t track all the sleep functions of my new polar watch. (Maybe that’s it the unavailable update) either way, the app should be updated to work without the constant update notifications.

title: Just Okay
text: Polar A360 was highly recommended to me by my spin instructor.  I don’t see what she sees and I’m really envious of my friends with fitbits. Polar doesn’t sync with any of the fitness or meal plan apps I use and that was disappointing but not a big deal.  What really bothers me is my device doesn’t sync automatically for some reason so every night I have to remember to do it so I can view my results in the app.  If it isn’t synced on a regular basis it doesn’t count steps correctly and resets itself which messes up the counts - that’s happened to me several times.  Also I don’t think the app is user friendly at all.

title: POLAR IS THE MOST ACCURATE TRAINER!

My old POLAR watches still work, itms the strap which is fixed with the watch and isn‘t replaceable. POLAR, do better!

Especially compared to the Beats web page.  I don’t see anything better or more useful about Flows web page.

Comically, there are pieces in the app that list pieces of my activities from weeks/months ago.  The app also constantly loses track of who I am, insisting my id and or password are wrong.

I suppose the app has potential, were it to actually function.  But I suspect it’s really about as useless as the cumbersome flow web page is.

title: Excellent product. Minor edit needed.
text:
To the developer. In the activity page, select month and go to the bottom. There is a chart for weight that shows lbs for unit but the y axis unit is actually shown in kg. 
To people looking for review of this app. It is a 5 star app. I hardly have issues with syncing and allow you to see your exercise results better than just looking them on the phone.

title: Used to be fine .. now Lost my HR graphic data !
text:
This is what I hate about updates .. they fix something and at the same time they break other things that used to work fine ..I’m Using the M430 and Vantage M mostly for running and since the last update, after my workout,I can’t see in the app the time I spend on each HR zone anymore... the color graphic shows nothing .. dead ! I tried everything .. resetting both  watches  .. uninstalling the app .. taking one watch out of the account and using the other  .. etc etc  and nothing works !! 
Polar fix this please !!!

title: What's happening lately with the app???
text: From a week from now, the app is not working correctly; it says,” we are loading data from your polar account,” but it never stops loading, and I can't see my account, and I can't sync my watch. I have tried to uninstall and reinstall twice, but the problem remains.

title: Beware, NO V800 On iPhone 11
text: I have been a loyal Polar user for many many years, but now have to write a poor review because Polar will not be updating the V800 to communicate with the IPhone 11. This is unacceptable! Why would Polar not continue to support the V800, the long tome top of the line  and most expensive Polar product?  I did not receive any discount offer to trade in my V800 for a comparable product. I guess I must fork over another $600 to keep the same performance I am used to. This is really bad.

title: Works but difficult to interpret
text:
The app functions just fine but reading the information is not intuitive or practical. I use this app to see how efficient my workouts were, and there’s no way to title the workouts, search for them, or  see what each workout was at a glance. There’s not even a function that analyzes your workout or tracks progress over time.

No idea what Id use the  “feed” tab for, and the activity tab is only useful for someone who wears the watch 24-7. 

I wish it was more intuitive for someone who wanted to see how efficient each workout was in order to improve over time.

title: Unknown what it can do
text: So I just downloaded the latest app version put out on 9/20. Now, I can’t get the app to open.  I get the home screen with the man running, but then it crashes.  I also can no longer open the flow sync app on my iMac. I have tried restarting my phone, and that will not work.  I don’t want to delete the app because I’m afraid all my data will be deleted too

title: Too Long to Upload
text: I enjoy using the Polar A300 with heart rate monitor BUT it takes way to long to upload the data from my A300 to the Polar app. Sometimes it takes 4-5 minutes or will go 4-5 minutes then give an error message. If this could be worked out it’d be virtually flawless and extremely user friendly.

title: Love the watch! ...struggling with the band.
text: This is a great watch! My second device from Polar and they’ve both been great. My only complaint with this particular watch is that the wrist bands wear out quickly. I’ve owned my watch just a few months and the wrist band has already loosened so much that the watch pops out of the band very easily. I’m afraid I’ll loose the watch because it pops out so easily 😐

title: The Polar is helpful but there are many kinks that need to be addressed
text: While the Polar is a great tool, many kinks need to be addressed!  I have had to repair the Bluetooth connection daily (for the past two days; previously I did not have to do so as it remained connected).  In the past, one’s weight could be viewed on the app and this feature no longer exists.  I do like the new sleep rating.

title: Has all of the info that I need
text: I really enjoy this app. It is simple to use, has an intuitive layout, and does everything I need. I have improved my 10 mile race time by 5 minutes utilizing heart rate training. I really like the cardio load feature of the app and the ability to program my workouts.

title: So far, so good
text: I use Polar Flow with my new m430 watch. The app itself seems to work very well and I like the overall functionality. My only complaint so far about the watch/app system is that my sleep is sometimes not detected which is frustrating. Another issue is that for certain types of exercise, it only shows a graph of heart rate compared to the fat burning or fitness zone and not the five heart rate training zones. Overall, a good app.

title: Polar watch and Polar Flow App
text:
I can not tell you how much I am enjoying my Polar Watch and the Polar Flow App. The watch records actions a heart rate for and exercise or activity you could think of. And the gives you incredible data which is charted over time. It’s very very easy to use and best training tool ever. It would take a whole book about how great this tool is for me.
I can not say enough.
Regards,
Jeff

title: Phenomenal!!
text: Polar has given me the ability to see how active (and inactive) I am during my day! This results in me being proud of myself finding a large mount of productivity at the end of the day or a motivation to push more the next day if I find a low productivity rate at the end of my day. I’d recommend and I do in fact recommend this brand and app to everyone!

title: Sync inconsistent
text: I’ve had the vantage m since it first came out. The syncing has been inconsistent at best. I can have the phone and watch in the same room and connected but have to try syncing several times before it takes. The gps works well enough and I have to clean the sensors or the HR monitor won’t work correctly. Those are the main features that I use. The call/text notifications are limited.

title: The truth hurts :)
text: The Polar Flow app definitely doesn’t pull any punches. It shows you exactly what you did or didn’t do? Eeek! The app is intuitive, has a great user interface, has great charts (that appeal to the geeky like me), links to maps with satellite views...and Polar updates it regularly! It’s a great tool to help you achieve your fitness goals. Now...if they could just get rid of that “undertrained” warning...haha

title: Excellent products from Polar
text: I have been using Polar products for 10+ years and they’ve been my first choice due to the precision and complexity of the gathered and processed data. The synchronization between the app and the web site is impeccable. I have only one comment, rather a suggestion — the Polar Balance scale should be more sensitive to goals depending the age of the person.

title: The Best!
text: I looked at many many fitness bands but the reason I picked a polar was strictly because of the app!  I love seeing my day at a glance, look back at weeks/months to see if I am improving. I love that my scale syncs here as well. Everything I need to see is right here. The ability to sync with my fitness pal app is over the top perfection!

title: Exercising More.
text: In the three and a half months since owning a Polar Vantage M, I have seen an increase in the number of workouts per week. I look forward to hiking, cycling or just a simple walk and the progress that comes with each session. The Polar Vantage M has spurred a resurgence in taking care of my body and my overall health.

title: Polar HR monitor
text: I’ve been a Polar customer since 1996.  I believe my latest purchase is very accurate regarding caloric expenditure and reading and recording my heart rate. I am a firm believer that most of us overestimate what we are burning via exercise and underestimate the number of calories we eat, which explains why many people have difficulty losing weight.  This is a great tool for a reality check!

title: Could use some modifications
text: Overall not bad but the design/layout should get some changes. The feed tab should show things in order by date. And the only thing that is kind of inconvenient is having to manually sync your watch to the app. It would be nice if every time you opened the app it synced automatically... or if you could set up times that the watch syncs.

title: Polar
text: A300 I purchased a new heart rate monitor for my a300 I read several reviews on the monitor stating that the monitor worked for swimming and because there was a swimming mode on the watch I purchased the new monitor can someone tell what I am doing wrong because the monitor won’t work for swimming the new monitor works fine in all other modes that’s why I gave it only three stars

title: Polar Flow
text:
One of the things I have noticed about the app is it sometimes but not always, allows me to move sessions around. It's nice function to have when you just didn't have time or don't like how the program is set up to move them around. Except it's completely hit or miss when it allows that to work.
Why do I have dumb blog notifications?! We should be able to turn this off.

title: Will not sync with M400
text: I am not sure why I have started to have issues completing a back-up via Bluetooth but there could possibly be a glitch. I haven’t had any issues with Bluetooth sync with any other device connecting to my iPhone, it’s only with the M400.  Please see is there are any bugs for iPhone 6 and m400 pairing issues. Thank you

title: Great fitness tracker
text:
I was a long time Fitbit user till google bought them. Lowered quality in devices and impending fees for data frustrated me enough to change. 

I used Polar heart rate monitors before (great quality) and checked their watches. More comfortable fit, great quality, all the features I needed in well priced device.

title: Polar, my usage and experiences
text: I have been using the polar wrist band for somewhat more than two years. My experiences have been mostly positive, but there have been times when it does not want to communicate with my iPhone. Frequent recharging is a bit of an inconvenience. Generally, I am pleased with the product, and I haven’t found one I like as well.

title: Big sigh
text: Been using this app with big satisfaction for about a month. Now all of a sudden I'm having problems to sync. Tried step by step after your support site to unpair, and pair it up again several if times, and that made me be able to sync the same day I did it.  But next morning it's the same problem for some reason. Really. Shouldn't be necessary to unpair and pair it up each day! 😳

title: Fine app
text: The app is fine to use for Vantage V model but still missing a lot of items that can be found in Garmin connect. A certain simplicity is missing, also finding users is not simple, having a graph of elevation on a run not available. But I can see other positive elements. Overall I wish and hope that Polar knows that this app is not the best platform and can be improved. Why not create a platform for users to brainstorm ideas or designs and polar takes best ideas for possible design and implementation.

title: Listen to your body
text:
I love this app!!! Anyone trying to get in shape or serious about fitness should get this it daily!! All the tools you get on this app is awesome!! It helps me to stay active, the active tracker really pushes me on these lazy days. I have been using a M400 for 3 years now and averaging 100%+ on my tracker every month, my Polar is the motivation l needed. One of my 2018 year resolutions was to get to at least 120% every month 💪🤪 
Thank you Polar!!

title: Making me want to work harder
text: I have been working out for a while now but afraid to get one of these devices for fear that I would not look good. Now I cannot help but check my heart rate, my calorie count and more. The flexibility of this device is great, the battery life is very good, and I actually feel healthier using it. No, I actually am healthier using it.

title: Started off on fire...
text: This app and polar H10 monitor started off on fire, then after 6 months it took a crap.  Nothing changed in how it was used or worn, yet the monitor stopped communicating with the app.  I followed EVERY SINGLE STEP, God knows how many times, and it still won’t work like it did the first 6 month.   It’s really frustration for someone like me with a technology background and still can’t get it to work. Way too expense for a piece of equipment that just turns into a chunk of crap.

title: Polar Flow Review
text:
I have used Garmin app and fitness watches for about 10 years. 
The Polar app and vantage M were easy to sync with my IPhone. Easy to read charts and easier to use. Highly recommend the product.
Both products worked, the Polar with its easy to use and understand charts are better for me.

title: Worthless App, Nice Watch
text: Loved my Polar M400 so much I upgraded to the M430.  That being said, this app is total garbage.  I wish Polar would invest in their app platform to bring it up to par with their competition - Polar Flow is clunky and relatively unintuitive.  My data never syncs automatically from my watch to my phone via Bluetooth, and the success rate is only about 25% when I manually initiate the process.  I use the watch as a stand alone device, but it would be much enhanced if I could actually log this data somewhere without whipping out the cord and plugging into my laptop like some caveman.

title: Great Watch for Active Senior
text: I used Polar products when I taught fitness classes, biked centuries and ran a few marathons. I really enjoy this fitness watch for what I am able to do as an active senior. Track my cardio load and sleep recharge. Try out exercise programs beyond tracking my steps. Keeps me moving! Affordable.

title: M400
text: My M400, while now no longer available, has been faithfully counting my mileage through 8 half marathons and over a thousand training runs. It has stayed more accurate than several other brands that my running buddies use and I love the ability to track dreadmill runs as easily as trail and road runs.

title: Great when it works
text:
Terrific stats and charts, I depend on it daily for a lot of activities. It also sends data to other apps like Strava. But two issues:
1. Although it has a lot of activity profiles to choose from, it doesn’t have everything and you can’t define your own.
2. Syncing takes a long time and sometimes I have to reboot the phone to make syncing work.

title: Love my Polar products
text: I have been using a Polar bike computer for longer than I can remember. Probably on our fourth generation at this point. There was a time when syncing was problematic, but those days are long gone. In our family right now are two bike computers, three watches and a Balance scale. They synch seamlessly and we love them!

title: Not very intuitive
text: The app is not intuitively laid out and takes a while to sync. For example, once you open the Nightly Recharge, the data should show up right away but it takes hours into the next day before it does. Shouldn’t your sleep automatically transfer to the app? I used a much less robust tracking system which did. Also, you can’t edit the sport profiles to add things that are not included.

title: Going strong 3yrs+
text: I’ve been using this app since I purchased a Polar A300 in December of 2015, updated phones, no issues with app. Only had to re-pair watch with iPhone/app. Great so far. Hope the app continues supporting the A300 and their loyal customers. In addition, my wife has not had any issues with her M400 nor the app. Very pleased with Polar products so far!

title: Quality
text: Very easy to use. Data is so interesting and useful. Only thing I would change is the round clock/data wheel. I struggle with when the day ends and when it starts. The 12 am doesnt show your sleep the day before. So if u go to sleep at 9p you don’t see the 3 hours. Just a little confusing.

title: Great product, bad customer service
text: App has an amazing interface and the watch is the best GPS watch I’ve had. Unfortunately PolarFlow doesn’t let you use the app without agreeing to share all personal data, which is in violation of the EUs data protection policy. I requested information on this and received no response from Polar.

title: Great for Athletes
text: I use the polar flow app together with my Polar Vantage M watch and Polar Verity Sense heart rate monitor. I do sports at a high level and it has been an incredible asset to measure my performance on the field with their cardio load status, and off the field with their sleep monitoring. Greatly recommend their ecosystem for anything sports related.

title: By far the best
text: I am a 20+ year old user of this product this is by far the most user-friendly non-complicated product I have ever used, if you’re looking for a no nonsense easy fix to your ultimate training log this is by far the best you’ll ever find.

title: Necessary Equipment
text: Lifting weights, going for a run, or even just taking a hike, I rely upon my Polar M400 to track my activities. The best part is the web page that allows me to see my workouts organized in one place and laid out in a way that helps me to track my progress but also to keep me motivated to stay disciplined.

title: Way better than an Apple Watch
text: I’ve had an Apple Watch and I can say without a doubt this watch (polar unite) and this app gives me so much more information than I could ask for. It has definitely thrusted my training forward by a lot! Thanks polar!

title: Covers Many Things I Need
text: I have been using the Polar app for about three years now. It works pretty well and gives me most of the info that I want including interacting with Lose It fir food info. Setup and learning how some things worked was quirky. There is a work around for most issues. Since it comes with my polar device it makes sense to keep using it.

title: Sync hasn't worked properly since update
text: For the last year, every three months or so, it stops syncing. In the last two days, the app says it synced, but the screens don't update. I've had to uninstall/reinstall multiple times, and only partial data shows up.   Have to sync with my computer to see the data in the diary. All of my other polar products have lasted forever--the Loop2 started failing in year 2 of ownership. The Flow App is unreliable and worthless--probably why it's free.

title: No more notifications?
text: Not only did I lose my sport profiles and data from before November with this last update, I also no longer get smart notifications. I’ve deleted the pairing and redone-which is no longer an easy process as others have mentioned, now a long and buggy process-as well as signed out and deleted the app plus deleted the pairing and started over with a new app install. Nothing seems to be bringing them back. Pretty aggravating that Polar has apparently begun pushing such poorly tested updates.

title: Need Activity Levels >3
text: This is the highest level and still too easy to hit. A couple miles walking to and from bus stops, some household work or trips up and down stairs at work and home and then all that’s needed, if anything, is a very light workout like 10 minutes of Kettle Bell and you’re at 100% for the day. Give us another couple levels to shoot for!

title: Using Polar for over 20 years!
text: Solid interface. Very few if any issues connecting via Bluetooth and PC USB. POLAR SUPPORT: Please bring back the ability to modify the Hr file to smooth the occasional BPM anomalies especially when the hr error is prolonged. A must have for serious athletes like myself. -V800 User.

title: JUST ONE GLITCH
text: Ok this app is great in everything it does, especially in displaying data collected from my watch. BUT every once in a while, the start-up screen displays a loading bar and says “Downloading the necessary bits and pieces” and the bar doesn’t load. I have to delete the app and redownload every time. PLEASE FIX THIS.

title: Great Product
text:
This app has awesome features and great support for your device. I’ve used many of the sports profiles with my A370 and it’s great to be able to see my activity level and heart rate throughout the whole activity. 

Since having mine, both of my brothers have purchased polar products.  I love it!

title: Step counter not accurate
text: I have noticed that the step counter is not quite accurate since I purchased the M430. I had another device and then, I could barely meet my daily goal of 10,000 steps a day. With the M430 I am showing over 20,000 steps almost each day. How can there be such a difference? I have not changed much my exercise routine. Does the device need to be calibrated or something?

title: Pro Athletes prefer Polar!
text: As a full disclosure I am a professional athlete sponsored by Polar. However, in my unbiased opinion as a garmin user for years the polar 430 watch and flow app are vastly superior to anything garmin offers. It's so much easier to get indepth HR and GPS data, and then the connection time is literally half of what it was with my garmin 235 watch. Love this thing!

title: With polar m400 & H10 strap Better than Apple Watch Series 3
text: Yes polar could make syncing automatic. But I like the intentionality of separately syncing to my 6-plus and MacBook. Other reviewers have underrated the sleep monitoring but it is competitive with Beddit 3 and my cPap machine. If you run or ride at night I’d get the v800. With the m400 you have to press a button to light the screen, however in daylight or low light the readability is excellent.

title: Great company!!!
text:
My polar watch is a bit dated but it still works great with the apps it allows me to say how long my stride is as well as my normal activity level in a day!

This app and watch help me to stay motivated to reach my fitness goals all in all I highly advise you to get a polar watch or you can always use there app polar beat!

title: Best workout app
text: I’ve been using the Polar watch for over 10 years. I’ve tried others but always come back to Polar. I find that it is the most accurate one when it comes to heart rate, calories and GPS tracking. Love it!

title: Only OK
text: This app works, but its synchronization with with Polar Beat is not the best.  When I finish a workout Strava syncs and notifies right away and this app just seems to get hung up and the workout doesn’t flow into it.  The website for this app works well, better than the app.  The social aspects of the app are also questionable, friends are not able to see anything that’s supposed to be public.  The hardware (A360 and H7) work really well.

title: Don’t need the sync cord
text: Great app. Just as informative as the desktop version. Syncing with my phone to the Polar web service is easier than doing so with the sync cable. I use the app mostly for analysis, review and recap but not while training.

title: Heart rate graph
text: I like this app and it’s many features, although difficult to manage at first, however I feel like it is missing a heart rate graph feature. With training it shows a heart rate graph, however it does not show one all throughout the day. The addition of this would greatly aid in recovery as well as planning difficult workouts.

title: STILL LOVE IT
text:
polar app is great except for a few reasons and it’s possible I just haven’t learn to navigate the app properly
It constantly requires syncing to the watch instead of it automatically Like the activity app for Apple
It has so much information and adjustments for you activity that it sometimes feels over whelming
Great app and watch other than that

title: Great product
text: Have used Polar products since about 1988. Tried Garman twice,Fitbit twice, and have always returned to Polar. Currently using A360 and love it. Polar Flow has been a reliable partner and I have enjoyed no longer having to keep a separate spreadsheet to plot activity and intensity. It also syncs with My Fitness Pal.

title: Great resource
text: I have been using the app for five years to track my exercising calories for 3 different sports with great results. It helps me to keep motivation high with my sport activities and eating habits. Combined with the computer to export my numbers gives a good view of the critical moments and how to be better.

title: All of it
text: Love this product. I owned polar products before but this one stands out . Tuff , easy to use , feature rich( covers so many sports ) . Reliable. Love gps. Smart watch features and app . Cost was in my budget. The data stored is much needed for training and it links to all my apple products .

title: Awesome watch
text: I love my polar watch!!  I have had 3 of them and all work great!!  I like the charger on the new one better as well.  It has all the options for working out and let’s me know when I have messages.  So happy with this product!!

title: So-so
text:
I purchased the Polar specifically for its heart rate monitor and sleep data recording. The former has not proven very reliable. And the sleep data is not useful if you do not sleep at least four hours in a row. It seems to be for sound sleepers only.

The watch is basically just useful for the traditional timing and distance of a run. 

For these results I could have bought a high end Garmin for half the price of the Polar.

title: App is inconsistent
text: I bought the polar Vantage when it initially came out and it took a while for the app to sync with the watch. It also did not keep training sessions in the app unless resynced. The app seems to be working a little better now, but the app has issues with consistently providing the feedback needed to perform at a high level.

title: Heart Rate tracking exercise data
text: Polar has been the pioneer of HRM watches and sensors. I’m a Registered Nurse and Clinical Programs Development Advisor that has been using HRM watches and devices as a Spin instructor and avid mountain biker and gravel cyclists. Polar has advanced monitoring and coaching supportable data that combined with over tech is amazing.

title: This app is not user friendly. Need major updates
text:
First of all the Feed is in no order at all and the options to sort do help. My workout and activity feed has July 29, followed by 28th, then August 1st, then August 3. I’ve worked out everyday since July 28th. It’s weird. 

Then it’s a little annoying that you can’t swipe left or right to view the next day you have to go back scroll up and down to select the day. 

Definitely can be better.

title: Love it but syncing is spotty
text: I have been using Polar products for a long time and usually have no complaints but the A370 seems to daily lose the Bluetooth connection and it sometimes takes multiple attempts before I can get it reconnected. Not sure if the problem is with the watch, the phone or the app. Very frustrating. Please someone come up with a solution.

title: Amateur Tri athlete
text: I have had Polar for many years.  I have always enjoyed the features offered from polar.  Always a good tool to review performances from my workouts.  From swimming to Triathlons and everything in between.  I plan to keep my polar as part of my regime for years to come.

title: Great app
text: I really enjoy the features it provides. The only thing I wish it had was capability to show battery life percentage. Just a little difficult to gauge when my watch is running low and it doesn’t provide a percentage when I sync it

title: Polar Flow App
text: Polar Flow is excellent! Data downloads from my M450 flawlessly. Highlights are: seeing heart rate zones on the map of a workout, highlighting a custom segment of ride and viewing its stats, the chart of recommended recovery time and the transfer of the workout to Strava. Again, Excellent!

title: Easy and comprehensive
text: Polar Flow just works! It collects data from my Loop 2 and my H10 monitor and it shows me info I can use in one place. Whether I’m looking at trends over a period of time or just a single workout, I get all the data I need in an easy to use format. Well done Polar!

title: Not updated
text: Not able to update to recent version on current Mac operating system. So map and other features are 2018 versions and not optimized.  Waiting for Godoy Not able to update to recent version on current Mac operating system. So map and other features are 2018 versions and not optimized.

title: Bluetooth updated
text: Why can’t updates be completed via Bluetooth?  Have a V650 for my wife and one for me.  They don’t interface well with Windows laptop and this haven’t been able to update for months.  Plus, when traveling and riding in other areas don’t always have a laptop to interface and upload maps.  Very expensive to send in for repairs so will likely find a new model which is mondernized.

title: Sync takes ages
text:
I try to sync my M430 with the app — added one more sport profile before the training. So I am on the bench for 20 minutes now NOT training, because my M430 is still syncing with a slow progress. Frustrating. It wasn’t like that, when I purchased my tracker. 
Also, the app tends to “loose” data from time to time (I have “keep data forever” in preferences).

title: Changed my exercise life!
text: I had been feeling tired after exercise sessions, but thought that my exertion was what I should be doing.  Bought an M600 eight months ago, and realized within a week that I had been overtraining thanks to Polar Flow.  Cannot exercise now without my M600

title: Never syncs
text: I used to be able to sync my A300 watch with the app via Bluetooth. It started working off and on and for the last few months it doesn’t work at all. It will only work if I connect my watch directly to my computer which is rare unless I need to charge it. It’s pretty annoying since I can no longer get my step and workout info to sync with the polar app and then get the stats in My Fitness Pal.

title: Very hard to understand how to use Polar Flow
text:
I am having a hard time using the Polar Unite watch. For example I am on a screen which on the top has three options: strength, cardio, strength and supportive. Can’t figure out how to switch from cardio to the other two. 

Maybe I don’t understand the basic concept of Polar Flow and Polar Unite. But what I was hoping for are some exercise routines in the strength and supportive categories. 

I happened on a screen that said other outdoor and while cycling, it measured the time and “steps” (which didn’t make sense) and some other parameters. But I don’t think it reported distance although in GPS. 

Is there a manual I should be reading or can someone walk me through the functionalities and features?

title: Great for general stuff
text: Really basic things and all I needed!! Even though you can see text messages and phone calls.. i don’t use it (you can disable). It’s super easy to sync with your phone and to “read” the results! I love this watch!

title: Caloric goal
text: Hello! My is Carolina and I love my watch and this app. Although I would like to know if there’s a way I could possibly change in settings or something the amount of calories I want to burn in a day as a goal. Thank you!!

title: Gives more information
text: Polar flow gives a more complete analysis of your workout than Apple Health. What I like is that it gives instantaneous speed, heart rate, and altitude at each location on the map.

title: Love it but things to improve
text: LOVE that it’s water proof and more accurate then Fitbit or iPhone. Not easy to snap in to charge and see if/it when charging and print way to small to read or even understand the sleep info especially on the app.

title: Difficult to make adjustments
text: When I 1st purchased the Watch I loved the options l.  However, now that I’ve had it for a while I’ve wanted to make adjustments to the display settings.  This seems to be impossible.  I’ve spent an inordinate amount of time trying to add and adjust my current settings.  I’m still not able to make adjustments.  Very unhappy!!

title: Year review
text: After a continual use of one year, I can say I am very pleased with my Polar Flow app.  I use it to track all my daily activities from sleep to running. I highly recommend Flow with any of the Polar tracking watches.

title: Connection issues
text: Getting the OH-1 to sync with this app involves a little luck and a lot of magic. Usually restarting the phone and sensor does the trick but not always, especially if mercury is in retrograde (joking of course, but there really is no rhyme or reason to why syncing is so difficult).  5% of the time it works the first time. I’ve tried this on 3 different platforms and get the same experience. Why can’t I force a sync from the app. Come on, basic functionality here.

title: Unreliable
